Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in a water habitat.
The student can label the fish and the water as part of the drawing.
The student can include other living things like plants or animals in their drawing.
The student can show how the fish and other living things use the water habitat to meet their needs (e.g., fish use water to swim).
The student can identify and label resources in the habitat, such as water and plants.
The student can show how different parts of the habitat work together to support the fish and other living things.
